content.description:
As you walk out onto the northern most of the two buttresses you will come to madrone (stump?) and bolt anchor used for setting up a rappel and toprope. Caution: 70 feet is a wild guess for the height.

 Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua Map page 66-65, Topo Ah page 162.Â
content.protection: One bolt and presumably a stump.
content.location: North side of the first buttress you come to as you walk the ridge south from Brittsan Rock. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua Map page 66-65.

content.description: Scramble the large chimney on the north side of the south buttress ridge. The left side of the chimney has good holds, the side is smooth and mossy. No gear was placed during the first ascent.
content.location: The second (south) buttress as you walk south along the ridge from Brittsan Rock. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua Map page 66-65..

content.description: These are the two prominent buttresses that stick out just south of Brittsan Rock. Tom & Gary (5.8) is located on the north side of the first ridge with One Time Chimney (5.5) on the north side of the second (southern) of the two ridges. These are two of the original first ascents in the Callahans. Once the trees grew to shade these two buttresses they became over grown. They are now back in full sun and maybe worth while project areas if access if ever restored to the area.
